main event: A glowing, pulsing light was observed moving rapidly across the sky in Marengo, Indiana on February 4, 1969.
interesting points: The object appeared similar to an evening star or planet, but its brightness varied more than is typical for a celestial object.
The object suddenly disappeared, as if vanishing like an aircraft or spaceship.
The object had a distinct circular shape, was dark gray or black in color, and seemed to be under intelligent control with a purposeful, wavy or oscillating motion.
The object was estimated to be about 50 to 100 feet in diameter and moving at a rapid rate, perhaps 25-30 mph.
The object passed behind some trees and was lost from view, and no other aircraft were seen in the vicinity.
